result.execSummary:
The defendant Laron D Jackson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay a fine of $300.00 PLUS all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges. To be paid by 08-22-2016. Court orders penalty for nonpayment of fines is conversion into a civil judgment and income tax interception.

With credit for 4 days. TIME SERVED DISPOSITION
Consecutive to: any other sentence

records.addlTxt: Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.
for defendant, filed.

GRANTING the defendant's request for a payment plan. The defendant shall pay $50.00 on September 20, 2016 and then $50.00 on the 15th day of each month thereafter until the balance is paid. Signed and filed. Copies to the defendant and DA's office.

Prior: 4080 North 25th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53209
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Cynthia Davis, Branch 21, for review. mag
LETTER FROM DEFENDANT REQUESTING PAYMENT PLAN, FILED

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by all parties as to sentencing. 


AS TO COUNT 2:    Pursuant to negotiations, case is DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 1
The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 4 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 4 DAYS time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION
The Court ordered the Defendant to pay a FINE of $300.00 plus all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges to be paid by 8-22-2016.Court orders penalty for Nonpayment of fines is conversion into a civil judgment and income tax interception.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
Pretrial Incarceration credit, received and filed.

Defendant Laron D Jackson in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Ian Franklin Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: sm
Case set for Jury Trial. Court informed parties have reached a resolution, court vacates jury trial and proceeds to plea and sentencing hearing.

Plea hearing proceeded.

AS TO COUNT 2:        Pursuant to negotiations, COUNT 2 is DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 1:   Case set for final pretrial. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter.
Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.

The defendant was advised of his Constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Elements of the Crime and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Case proceeded to sentencing hearing.

Defendant Laron D Jackson in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Ian Franklin Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: sm
Case set for Jury trial. Parties informs the court they are ready to proceed. Case passed.

Defendant Laron D Jackson in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for jury trial.  First call.  Both parties are ready to proceed.  Case passed.

Case recalled at 10:51 am.  Court is currently in trial on another matter.  No ADA available for spin.  Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 21.  Jury trial scheduled for May 23, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Laron D Jackson in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for motion hearing. Both parties advise the court that the motion hearing is not needed. State advises no onscene statements will be used. Defense rejects states offer and requests a jury trial. Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 21.  Jury trial scheduled for April 27, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Laron D Jackson in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for jury trial.  Discussions held as to motion filed by defense.  Court orders case adjourend for motion hearing to Branch 45.  Motion hearing scheduled for March 30, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Motion to Suppress Statements, filed.

Defendant Laron D Jackson in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case heard off the record. Final Pretrial held. Parties ready to proceed to trial, neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned to branch 45 for Jury Trial at 8:30 am on 1-13-2016.

Defendant Laron D Jackson in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jury trial scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Laron D Jackson in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Status of Counsel scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Defendant Laron D Jackson in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties are notified that effective September 14, 2015 this case will be reassigned to Judge Michelle Ackerman Havas, Branch 45 in Room 515 of the Courthouse. Case set for Plea & Sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Absolute Sobriety.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Laron D Jackson in court.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 23 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 08-06-2015 at 01:30pm
